name: AnandTech - Minus Garbage Plus Width (May 2017)
description:
This is a full clean-up of AnandTech.com to make it more reader-friendly. It removes the right column, widens the content area, and removes ads.

Let me know if you find anything I missed, if you have any suggestions, or if something breaks/changes that I need to address.
additional_info:
Removed:
* entire right column
* all ads (left me know if you find one!)

Changed:
* widened the landing page/blogroll, articles, comments, gallery, and benchmarks to fill the now-hidden right column's space
* centered article images, videos, thumbnails, and thumbnail boxes

Not Changed:
* text sizes
* fonts
* pictures/logos
* background/text colors

UPDATES:
2017-05-20 - Updated style to cleanup their new forum layout and we now force-widen lists in articles.
2016-05-07 - Additional full-page ad background removal, along with specific styling that came with it.
2016-04-21 - Full-width fix for the 'tags' pages and centered two product comparisons on bench.
2016-01-10 - I noticed AnandTech did a little bit of restyling to make their site more responsive (they mostly just added styles for mobile and tablet screen sizes), so I did a full rework of my styles to clean it up a bit and ensure it does everything I originally created it to do.
2013-10-14 - AT changed some page structuring and the page number nav, so I fixed what that effected and cleaned up some code related to those.
2013-07-16 - Fix for blogroll 'top 3' code change by AT, should hold up better if there are any more changes there.
2013-06-19 - 'Print' view corrections, centered another video type.
2013-05-30 - Cleaned up selectors, locked the background color (sometimes changed to suit ads on side), simplified some centering, stretch page nav text links in articles, hid some more forum ads, stretched ol and ul article elements.
2013-03-31- Re-write complete, just need to do a little testing and some cleanup, and possibly account for other video types (non-youtube).
2013-03-14 - Full re-write, what's available currently is a work-in-progress. So far I've only worked on the main page, no articles or bench code specifically, yet.
2013-03-01 - Due to AnandTech redesigning their site, the current code is now obsolete (re-writing).
